hints.content: Every time we move right on the number line, we add the distance we move.

$478\redE{+2}=480$

[[☃ image 1]]

Let's keep adding to label the other points on the number line.

options.alt: A number line with 3 unequally spaced tick marks. From left to right, the tick marks are labeled 478, 480, and an unlabeled tick mark. An arrow labeled plus 2 is above the number line beginning at 478 and ending at 480. !

A number line with 4 unequally spaced tick marks. From left to right, the tick marks are labeled 478, 480, 500, and question mark. An arrow labeled plus 2 is above the number line beginning at 478 and ending at 480. An arrow labeled plus 20 is above the number line beginning at 480 and ending at 500. !

A number line with 4 unequally spaced tick marks. From left to right, the tick marks are labeled 478, 480, 500, and 841. An arrow labeled plus 2 is above the number line beginning at 478 and ending at 480. An arrow labeled plus 20 is above the number line beginning at 480 and ending at 500. An arrow labeled plus 341 is above the number line beginning at 500 and ending at 841. !

hints.content:
This leads to the same sum because, altogether, that is a distance of:

$\redE{2}+\purpleE{20}+\maroonE{341}= \blueE{363}$

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line with 4 unequally spaced tick marks. From left to right, the tick marks are labeled 478, 480, 500, and 841. An arrow labeled plus 2 is above the number line beginning at 478 and ending at 480. An arrow labeled plus 20 is above the number line beginning at 480 and ending at 500. An arrow labeled plus 341 is above the number line beginning at 500 and ending at 841. An arrow labeled plus 363 is above the number line beginning at 478 and ending at 841. !

hints.content:
This is DeAndre's completed number line:

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line with 4 unequally spaced tick marks. From left to right, the tick marks are labeled 478, 480, 500, and 841. An arrow labeled plus 2 is above the number line beginning at 478 and ending at 480. An arrow labeled plus 20 is above the number line beginning at 480 and ending at 500. An arrow labeled plus 341 is above the number line beginning at 500 and ending at 841. An arrow labeled plus 363 is above the number line beginning at 478 and ending at 841. !

question.content:
DeAndre thinks about $478+\blueE{363}$ as $478+\redE{2}+\purpleE{20}+\goldE{341}$ to solve in his head. Here is part of a number line to represent his thinking.

[[☃ image 1]]

**Which number line correctly labels the other tick marks?** 

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A number line with 4 unequally spaced tick marks. From left to right, the tick marks are labeled 478, an unlabeled tick mark, an unlabeled tick mark, and an unlabeled tick mark. An arrow labeled plus 2 is above the number line beginning at 478 and ending at the first unlabeled point. An arrow labeled plus 20 is above the number line beginning at the first unlabeled point and ending at the second unlabeled point. An arrow labeled plus 341 is above the number line beginning at the second unlabeled point and ending at the third unlabeled point. An arrow labeled plus 363 is above the number line beginning at 478 and ending at the third unlabeled point. !
